ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and as for beggars, do not berate them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And do not drive the beggar away,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and chide not him who asks,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and do not reject the beggars
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And do not rebuke the beggar.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And repulse not the one who asks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And as for him who asks, do not chide (him),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and as for the beggar, scold him not;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Therefor the beggar drive not away,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and do not chide the one who asks for help;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And as to the beggar, chide thou him not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and as for the beggar, do not chide him;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: nor drive away the one who asks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And as for the petitioner, do not repel [him].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [93:10] and as for the beggar, do not drive [him] away, [do not] repel him on account of his poverty,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Therefore the beggar drive not away) nor rebuke,
